_comment_instructions: 1. Copy this file and rename it (e.g., my_batch_config.json)
_comment_instructions2: 2. Replace ALL fields marked with << USER: ... >>
_comment_instructions3: 3. Use docs/SELECTOR_GUIDE.md to find CSS selectors
_comment_instructions4: 4. Test with a small batch first to verify selectors work
default_images_path: << USER: REPLACE WITH BASE PATH WHERE IMAGE FOLDERS ARE STORED >>

urls._comment: URLs for CardDealerPro workflow - verify these are current

general_settings._comment: << USER: FILL IN ALL FIELDS BELOW >>
general_settings._comment2: These values will be entered into the general settings form
general_settings._comment_batch_type: Must exactly match dropdown option text. Example: 'Sports Cards'
general_settings._comment_sport_type: Must exactly match dropdown option text. Example: 'Baseball', 'Basketball', etc.
general_settings._comment_title_template: Must exactly match dropdown option text
general_settings._comment_description: Example: 'Mint condition 2024 Topps Chrome cards from hobby box'

optional_details._comment: << USER: ADD OPTIONAL FIELDS HERE OR LEAVE AS EMPTY OBJECT {} >>
optional_details._comment2: These fields are completely optional - leave as {} to skip
optional_details._comment3: If you add fields here, also add corresponding selectors below

selectors._comment2: << USER: REPLACE ALL SELECTORS BELOW WITH ACTUAL CSS SELECTORS >>
selectors._comment3: Use Chrome DevTools to find selectors (see docs/SELECTOR_GUIDE.md)
selectors._comment4: Test each selector in browser console: document.querySelector('selector')
selectors.username_input: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR USERNAME INPUT >>
selectors.password_input: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR PASSWORD INPUT >>
selectors.login_button: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR LOGIN BUTTON >>
selectors.create_batch_button: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR CREATE BATCH BUTTON >>
selectors.batch_name_input: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR BATCH NAME INPUT >>
selectors.batch_type_select: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR BATCH TYPE DROPDOWN >>
selectors.sport_type_select: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR SPORT TYPE DROPDOWN >>
selectors.title_template_select: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR TITLE TEMPLATE DROPDOWN >>
selectors.description_input: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR DESCRIPTION INPUT/TEXTAREA >>
selectors.continue_button_general: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR CONTINUE BUTTON ON GENERAL SETTINGS PAGE >>
selectors._comment_optional: Only needed if you have fields in optional_details above
selectors.create_batch_submit: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR CREATE BATCH BUTTON ON OPTIONAL DETAILS PAGE >>
selectors._comment_optional_fields: Add selectors for optional fields here using format: optional_{field_name}
selectors.magic_scan_button: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR MAGIC SCAN BUTTON >>
selectors.upload_file_input: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR FILE UPLOAD INPUT >>
selectors._note_upload_input: This input is often hidden - use browser DevTools to find it
selectors.upload_continue_button: << USER: CSS SELECTOR FOR CONTINUE BUTTON AFTER UPLOAD >>
selectors._comment_validation: These are for future validation features - can leave as placeholders for now
selectors.image_count_display: << OPTIONAL: SELECTOR FOR IMAGE COUNT TEXT >>
selectors.image_thumbnail_container: << OPTIONAL: SELECTOR FOR IMAGE THUMBNAILS CONTAINER >>

workflow._comment_validate: Set to true when you have image_count_display or image_thumbnail_container selectors configured

_footer_comment3: 1. Ensure .env file has CDP_USERNAME and CDP_PASSWORD
_footer_note: For detailed help, see docs/QUICKSTART.md and docs/SELECTOR_GUIDE.md
